DoubleVectorProperty.name: Percentile
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the percentile for measurement. Setting is to 50.0 is equivalent with computing the median.

SourceProxy.name: ResampleToHyperTreeGrid
SourceProxy.label: Resample To Hyper Tree Grid

Documentation.long_help: Warning: this plugin is a beta. Adaptive Mesh Refinement using a Hyper Tree Grid. The output is a Hyper Tree grid such that its leaves store a value measuring some property of the set of points inside them. Leaves are subdivided given some user defined heuristic.
Documentation.short_help: Adaptive Mesh Refinement using a Hyper Tree Grid.

SourceProxy.Documentation: This Filter generates a Hyper Tree Grid from any input data set which has point data. Leaves of the Hyper Tree Grid are subdivided if the subset of points inside that leave match a crietrion set by the user on the input point data. The criterion is displayed, as well as an other way to represent the set of data in the subset.

IntVectorProperty.name: Dimensions
IntVectorProperty.label: Dimensions
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Dimensions of the Hyper Tree Grid.

IntVectorProperty.name: BranchFactor
IntVectorProperty.label: Branch Factor
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Branch factor of the output Hyper Tree Grid.

IntVectorProperty.name: MaxDepth
IntVectorProperty.label: MaxDepth
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Maximum tree depth of output Hyper Tree Grid.

StringVectorProperty.name: PointDataArrays
StringVectorProperty.label: Point Data Array to process
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Add a point array by name to be resampled.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.label: Subdividing Criterion Array
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Input point data used as a subdividing criterion to build the hypertree grid.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseMax
IntVectorProperty.label: Use Max
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If not checked, Max is set to infinity.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Max
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Leaves are subdivided if the Subdividing Criterion is lower than Max.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseMin
IntVectorProperty.label: Use Min
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If not checked, Min is set to minus infinity.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Min
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Leaves are subdivided if the Subdividing Criterion is greater than Min.

IntVectorProperty.name: MinimumNumberOfPointsInSubtree
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Nodes are subdivided if an only if their non-empty children have at least this amount of points.

IntVectorProperty.name: InsideRange
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Inverts the criterion. Leafs are subdivided if the Subdividing Criterion is outside of [Min, Max]

IntVectorProperty.name: NoEmptyCells
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Forces the output hyper tree grid to not produce empty cells by limiting subdivisions. When producing the Hyper Tree Grid output, if any of the potential leaves of a node don't have point data but intersect with the geometry of the input, the node is not subdivided, and thus becomes a leaf. This parameter is trumped by Extrapolate Point Data parameter.

IntVectorProperty.name: ExtrapolatePointData
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Forces the output hyper tree grid to not produce empty cells by extrapolation. Leaves intersecting the input geometry but not having any point data are extrapolated by averaging. The averages are computed from the Hyper Tree Grid that would be produced if this parameter was off, using Von Neumann super cursors.

ProxyProperty.label: Subdividing Criterion
ProxyProperty.name: ArrayMeasurement
ProxyProperty.Documentation: This property sets the array measurement method used for subdividing leaves in the hyper tree grid.

ProxyProperty.label: Averaging method
ProxyProperty.name: ArrayMeasurementDisplay
ProxyProperty.Documentation: This property sets an extra array measurement method only for visualization purposes. This measurement is applied to the list of inputs.
